title.narrative: Mechanism 18318 - County Measurement Learning & Accountability Project (CMLAP)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
This activity aims at strengthening leadership and management including governance structures for outcome measurements, learning and accountability systems at county and sub-county levels to empower county health management teams to effectively take control of measuring expected health outcomes, use results for learning and scaling up best practices, and increasing results and resources accountabi Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.8: Orphans and Vulnerable Children. Activities are aimed at improving the lives of orphans and other vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV/AIDS, and doing so in a measurable way. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. objectives

This activity aims at strengthening leadership and management including governance structures for outcome measurements, learning and accountability systems at county and sub-county levels to empower county health management teams to effectively take control of measuring expected health outcomes, use results for learning and scaling up best practices, and increasing results and resources accountability amongst all the key stakeholders in the focal counties. In addition, this activity will support county health teams to increase availability, analysis and use of quality health data on HIV/AIDS, TB, RMNCH, FP, nutrition and malaria from facility and community routine monitoring system, child protection management information system, disease surveillance, civil registration and vital statistics, IDSR, special studies and surveys.

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
